required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of Preterm Birth Using Cervical Pessary in Pregnant Women With Short Cervix
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial: Prevention of Preterm Birth Using Cervical Pessary in Pregnant Women With Short Cervix (PECEP)

brief_summary.textblock: Placement of a vaginal pessary reduces significantly the rate of spontaneous preterm birth in pregnant women with short cervical length at 18-22 weeks scan.

detailed_description.textblock: This trial includes pregnant women undergoing routine ultrasound examination at 18.0 to 22.6 weeks of gestation.

primary_outcome.description: Number of spontaneous preterm births before 34 weeks occurred in each group.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who experience pessary withdrawal. This outcome measure only applied to the Experimental (Pessary Arm) and no data were collected from participants in the No Intervention _(No Pessary Arm).

arm_group.description: Placement of arabin pessary since 23 weeks until 37 weeks

intervention.description: Placement of a silicon pessary in the vagina, around the cervix.
intervention.other_name: Vaginal pessaries CE 0482 MED / CERT ISO 9003 /EN 46003

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton pregnancy
- Minimal age of 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major fetal abnormalities (requiring surgery or leading to infant death or severe handicap)
- SROM at the time of randomization
- Cervical cerclage in situ
- Active vaginal bleeding
- Previous cone biopsy or cerclage
- Major uterine structural anomalies
- Placenta previa

participant_flow.recruitment_details: You are right that our fi rst planned sample size was 2780 patients. However, after the first interim analysis, and in accordance with the advice of our Data Monitoring Committee, the protocol was amended to reach the new and fi nal sample size.

group.title: Expectant Management
group.description: Expectant management: Current conventional management.

group.title: Placement of Arabin Pessary Since 23 Weeks Until 37 Weeks
group.description: Placement of arabin pessary since 23 weeks until 37 weeks Silicon ring (Arabin Pessary): Placement of a silicon pessary in the vagina, around the cervix.

group.title: Expectant Management
group.description: Both groups were seen by the clinical team of the trial at each centre every month until delivery. Transabdominal ultrasonography was done for fetal biometries and wellbeing, clinical questionnaire was administered for confi rmation of correct device placement in the pessary group (fi gure 2), vaginal swab was taken for study of bacteriological infection, and transvaginal ultra sonography was done to measure cervical length (fi gure 3)

group.title: Placement of Arabin Pessary Since 23 Weeks Until 37 Weeks
group.description: The pessary was removed during the 37th week of gestation. Indications for pessary removal before this time were active vaginal bleeding, risk of preterm labour with persistent contractions despite tocolysis, or severe patient discomfort.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Spontaneous Delivery Before 34 Completed Weeks
outcome.description: Number of spontaneous preterm births before 34 weeks occurred in each group.
outcome.time_frame: Between 24 and 34 weeks

group.title: No Intervention: No Pessary
group.description: No pessary will be used. Subjects will receive standard obstetrical care and management.

group.title: Experimental: Pessary
group.description: Use of Arabin pessary. Pessary placed around the cervix between 20 and 23 weeks gestation, and will be removed during the 37th week of pregnancy.

reported_events.time_frame: Starting at 24 weeks until 28 days after birth

group.title: Expectant Management
group.description: Expectant management: usual management

group.title: Placement of Arabin Pessary Since 23 Weeks Until 37 Weeks
group.description: Silicon ring (Arabin Pessary): Placement of a silicon pessary in the vagina, around the cervix.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
